IUCN Red List (Species Assessed for Global Conservation)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits usually slow-flowing, shallow, clear water streams, usually with a pebble or sand substrate.  Territorial, usually solitary, juveniles form small schools of 3-5 individuals.  Feeds on terrestrial insects and detritus.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  common in the south west quarter and mid-hill region of the Mahaweli basin, including the lower hills up to about 800 m.  Found throughout Kelani and Kalu River basins, Sri Lanka.
dataObjects.references: Pethiyagoda, R. 1991 Freshwater fishes of Sri Lanka. The Wildlife Heritage Trust of Sri Lanka, Colombo. 362 p. (Ref. 6028)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Pethiyagoda, R. 1991 Freshwater fishes of Sri Lanka. The Wildlife Heritage Trust of Sri Lanka, Colombo. 362 p. (Ref. 6028)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Male builds bubble nest under a leaf, a submerged overhanging rock or sometimes at the surface to hold the eggs. About 500 eggs are spawned. Eggs demersal, light pink, < 1 mm diameter. Male guards nest. Eggs hatch in 2-3 days after spawning. Both parents tend nest of larvae.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial
